documents.title: littleport road death : 'incident was clearly avoidable '
text: police investigating the death of two men killed in a crash near littleport , cambridgeshire , say the incident was `` avoidable '' .
pc james thorne said : `` mitchell butler-eldridge made a conscious decision to overtake a vehicle when it was clearly dangerous to do so and this resulted in the tragic loss of life .
`` this incident was clearly avoidable had he thought about his actions and i welcome the sentence passed .

`` one bad driving decision and a dangerous manoeuvre has robbed two families of loved ones , and this sentence should serve as a deterrent to people whose standard of driving falls below what we , as society , expect . ''

butler-eldridge , 28 , of sydney terrace , king 's lynn , norfolk , was jailed for five years after pleading guilty at cambridge crown court to two counts of causing death by dangerous driving at a previous hearing .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: an illustration of the dangers balloons pose to wildlife
text: we shared a photograph earlier of a bird that had got its beak caught up in balloon ribbons , and mentioned that some people believe balloon releases should be banned .
ann guyton , from great yarmouth , emailed this photograph to us , taken on yarmouth beach .
she says : `` when the wave brought it in , the balloons dragged it down .
`` there was no-one else about on the beach and the poor thing was soon taken right out to sea again . ''

documents.title: ed balls prepares to tackle the charleston on strictly come dancing
text: norwich city chairman ed balls will be hoping his charleston performance tomorrow night wins more points from the judges than his waltz did last week on bbc strictly come dancing .
balls and his partner katya jones are currently bottom of the leader board , so to quote yazz - `` the only way is up '' .

documents.title: sunday traders want changes
text: great yarmouth town centre has lost its british home stores , marks & spencer has moved out of town , and even the spar shop has left the market place .
but traders are still determined to make their businesses a success .
footfall figures for the town centre show there 's more trade between 16:00 and 17:00 , and one idea to get more revenue is to open and close later on sundays .
nick spencer , from the market gates shopping centre , says his tenants are asking about whether opening hours can be changed .
this might suit those in search of retail therapy , but what about the impact on staff ?
mr spencer says they 'd do a survey on each retailer , who 'd consult their staff to see if they could get in and out of work .
`` if the transport links are there , anything between 10:30 and 11:00 [ sunday opening times ] is as late as we 'd push it , as it would affect our centre staff as well , '' he said .
we 've had some approach from retailers with a view to next summer if the business case says the optimum time is 10:30 to 16:30 we 'd try and standardise that across the year . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: ring out the old and ring out the new : campaign to save school bell
text: every day , for more than 100 years , the bell has begun and ended the day for pupils at fakenham junior school .
but now , the timber tower , bell and clapper are in need of restoration .
much of the damage to the tower has been done by weather , and over the years it 's had remedial work done many times .
the repairs are expected to cost £ 36,000 - but as school business manager karen rogers explains , they ca n't justify spending money that should be spent on children 's education .
so the school 's launched a funding raising campaign - `` get well bell '' - .
in the hope the local community , many of whom went to the school , will step in and help .
headteacher adam mason says the tower will come down around easter , and he hopes it 'll be back up by this time next year .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for causing double fatal crash
text: a man who killed two men in a crash near littleport , cambridgeshire , has been jailed for five years .
mitchell butler-eldridge was sentenced earlier today at cambridge crown court after pleading guilty to two counts of causing death by dangerous driving at a previous hearing .
the 28-year-old of sydney terrace , king 's lynn , norfolk , was driving his volkswagen passat along the a10 lynn road on 18 february 2015 when the crash happened .
he attempted an overtaking manoeuvre before a bend and lost control of the car , causing it to collide with an austin mini .
the driver of the mini , timothy wildbore , 24 , from victoria street , littleport , and his passenger , andrew thornewell , 28 , from hollendale walk , ely , both died as a result .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ndr : b1149 to close on monday
text: the main road through horsford is to close temporarily to allow contractors working on the northern distributor road ( ndr ) to divert a gas main .
the b1149 will close at 09:30 on monday and traffic will be diverted along church street to the a140 .
it reopens on friday , 7 october .
the second closure , allowing access to holly lane as well as church street from horsford , begins on monday , 10 october for five days .

norfolk county council spokesman quentin brogdale says the gas main , which feeds a large area north of norwich , has to be diverted before work can begin on a new junction for the a140 , which is critical to the whole ndr project .
construction work for the ndr is on schedule and mr brogdale expects the road to be opened in early 2018 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gate crush death : fitter breached safety rules
text: a man has been found guilty of breaching safety rules after a woman was crushed to death under a heavy iron gate he had fitted .
jill lunn , 56 , was pinned under the automatic gate when it fell on her in april 2013 .
she died from a heart attack .
mrs lunn had been trying to close the gate at her home in blofield heath , near norwich , after the automatic mechanism failed , norwich crown court heard .
the gate , which weighed around a third of a tonne , had been fitted by robert churchyard , 51 , of turner road , norwich .
he had denied gross negligence manslaughter and breaching a general duty of care in his work , but was found guilty of the latter after a trial .
however , a jury yesterday failed to reach a verdict on the gross negligence manslaughter charge .
the case was adjourned until 17 october at which time a decision will be made whether to go ahead with a retrial or progress to sentencing .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: charity helps with end-of-life issues
text: a new charity to help people who are facing a terminal illness or bereavement has been launched in west norfolk .
solace end of life support has been founded by former nurse shelley lamprell-josephs , who saw a need for people to have more support at a difficult time in their lives .
volunteers provide emotional , practical and social support , answering questions and liaising with other people if necessary .
shelley recalls a day , when as a student nurse , she comforted a woman whose husband had collapsed when he 'd brought her in for a routine hospital operation .
she sat with the woman , holding her hand , and comforted her .
six months later i saw her in out-patients and she told me what a difference i 'd made that has stayed with me for 20 years it 's about an awareness of people 's needs . ''

documents.title: norwich city fan wins after bookie gets murphy twins mixed up
text: norwich city 's identical twins josh and jacob murphy have been helping supporters to beat the bookmakers .

paddy power paid out on josh murphy scoring a goal against burton albion last saturday , even though it was actually his brother jacob who had scored the goal to put norwich 2-1 up during the 3-1 win against burton .
city fan ashley howell won £ 45 from one such bet .
paddy power spokesman lewis davey told us that he will be allowed to keep his winnings .
`` we all make honest mistakes , the confusion is quite easy to make , '' said mr davey .
`` this week we have actually put their first names on our site as well .
we 're offering 33-1 if jacob dyes his hair yellow this weekend . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: breydon water deaths 'not sus
text: the deaths of a man and woman whose bodies were recovered from breydon water near great yarmouth are not being treated as sus say norfolk police .
emergency services were called out shortly before 11:30 yesterday , after a member of the public reported seeing two bodies on the mudflats .
the coastguard and fire service assisted in the recovery of the bodies .
officers have identified the man and woman as a local couple aged in their early 60s .
police say they are satisfied there are no sus circumstances .
inquiries to trace the next-of-kin are continuing .

the driver of the nissan , a man in his 60s , was pronounced dead at the scene .
the driver of the van had minor injuries and was taken to the norfolk and norwich university hospital for treatment , and discharged at lunchtime .
the road was closed while emergency services dealt with the incident .

documents.title: 'no idea ' about how long bodies had been on mudflats
text: it is not known how long the bodies of a man and woman have been on mudflats in great yarmouth , police say .
det insp chris burgess told bbc radio norfolk officers had `` absolutely no idea '' of timescales `` at this stage '' .
`` as you 've just seen the bodies have only just been recovered so it 's very very early on and at the moment we 're just treating as unexplained , '' he said .
he said he was not aware of any missing persons in the area and praised other emergency services for their help .
`` without the help of the [ other ] services , we would n't be where we are now , '' he said .

documents.title: death of man and woman remains 'unexplained '
text: det insp chris burgess , of norfolk police , has just been on radio norfolk .
he 's confirmed two bodies have been found .
he said : `` i can tell you at the moment we 're unsure if it is a crime .
we 're looking into the circumstances of the death of two persons , which is unexplained at this time and we believe it is a male and a female . ''

because of the state of the tide , i think they 'll be dealing with mudflats now rather than deeper water but two bodies have been discovered in the breydon water and it 's not clear exactly how they 've ended up there .

documents.title: some facts about breydon water
text: breydon water is a large expanse of water that opens into the sea through the port of great yarmouth .
the rivers yare , waveney and bure flow into breydon , which connects the northern broads to the southern broads .
breydon water is tidal , and currents can be significant .
high water today this morning was at 08:38 , and the next low tide is 15:14 .
the broads authority warns that currents can be significant .
the northern broads can only be accessed under two old bridges , and they recommend vessels depart or enter at slack water , approximately one hour after low tide at great yarmouth .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

firefighters were called to the scene at around 22:30 .
no-one was hurt , but power supplies in the area were cut off for most of the night .
i 've been to school road this morning , and have seen burnt-out corrugated iron , melted wheelie bins and stains on the road from the fire .
sohail anjum was one of those who had to leave his home .
he told me he was watching television when his wife alerted him to the blaze .
his house was damaged by the heat from the flames , melting his plastic windows and features on his front door .
after alerting neighbours and the emergency services , mr anjum and his family spent the night with friends .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

emergency services were called to shortthorn road , in stratton strawless , shortly before 06:00 , after a lorry and a truck were involved in a collision .
the driver of the truck , a man in his 60s , was pronounced dead at the scene .
the road remains closed while investigations are carried out .

canaries boss alex neil says his side had done everything they needed to do until the last 90 seconds .
with 90 seconds to go we were winning 3-2 it 's really , really frustrating .
we 'd done enough at that point to win the game . ''

documents.title: challenging year for wayland prison
text: the latest report from the independent monitoring board ( imb ) , the body that monitors the welfare of prisoners in the uk , shows it 's been a challenging year for wayland jail .
report author roger marston says volunteers from the imb have access to meetings in the prison , including those involving discussions on the numbers of incidents within the jail .
the report shows there 's been a rise in the number of incidents of prisoner-on-prisoner and prisoner-on-staff attacks but mr marston is unable to provide figures .
wayland prison was built 31 years ago , and has the capacity for 1,017 adult male offenders .
the report , which covers the period from june 2015 to may 2016 , reveals :

documents.title: council apology over foster carer treatment
text: norfolk county council have apologised following a damning report that says they let down children and did n't treat foster carers properly .
the parker review , which began last year , followed claims that foster carers had children unlawfully taken away from them .
the review has been published today , and it says some carers were treated unfairly .

michael rosen , the council 's director of children 's services , says they 're hoping to show that the organisation is `` willing to learn , work in partnership with foster carers and former leavers '' .

text: a new report says violence is getting worse at a norfolk prison where the governor was recently attacked .

a report by the independent monitoring board , which carries out inspections of prisons in england and wales , says there 's been a rise in the number of attacks and staff on inmates and staff at the jail near watton .

mark day , of the prison reform trust , says it 's not a surprise to see mounting levels of frustration in the prison , when there 's overcrowding , a shortage of staff , and a lot of the inmates being held far away from home .

there needs to be sufficient numbers of staff to prisoners to handle any incidents that may occur prisons essentially hold too many people for the capacity they have and this adds to the problems of safety . ''

documents.title: 'not everyone who calls us needs us , ' says ambulance chief
text: people in the east of england are being asked to help decrease demand on the region 's ambulance service .

robert morton , the chief executive of the east of england ambulance service , says there is a `` huge capacity gap '' between the number of calls the service receives and the number of staff it has .
`` unless you have an ambulance at every crossroad , you are not going to be everywhere within eight minutes , that 's a fact of life , '' he said .
`` we need support from the community to drive down demand .
frankly , not everybody who calls us needs us . ''
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance service managers to respond to calls
text: the chief executive of the region 's ambulance service said an `` explosion '' in demand has led to managers being asked to respond to calls .
bosses at the east of england ambulance service have been told they will have to do a minimum of two shifts a week responding to calls .
speaking after today 's board meeting , chief executive robert morton said it was not a `` sustainable '' way of working in the long term .
`` right now the priority is for us to respond to our patients , improve our response times and support our staff , '' he said .
`` one of the ways we feel we can do that right now is to ask our managers to go out and respond .

`` we recognise it 's not sustainable in the long term and we recognise that there are elements of our managerial workload which simply are not going to get done , but patients and staff have to be the priority . ''
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: magpies v canaries : benitez 'wo n't consider sharing the spoils '
text: newcastle manager rafa benitez says he 's fully focused on achieving three points against norwich city tonight .
the canaries have won five in a row and will aim to get back to the top of the championship with a victory at st james ' park later , but benitez has other ideas .
`` i 'm not thinking about a draw , i 'm always thinking about the win against any team , '' he said .
`` i can see our team and we are as strong as anyone .
`` everything i can see gives me the confidence that we will be where we want to be , at the top of the table . ''
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: funding for rehabilitation centre had 'come to an end '
text: earlier we told you that the henderson unit in norwich was closing due to a lack of funding .
the facility at the julian hospital site was set up at the start of last year to support patients who were preparing to go home .
it was designed to relieve bed-blocking at the norfolk and norwich university hospital .
the clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) for north norfolk , south norfolk and norwich said it had been set up with funding provided by monitor , part of nhs improvement .
a spokesman for the ccgs said pre-agreed funding had now come to an end and they were not able to provide additional money .
he said : `` we continue to work closely with the n & n and other partners to ensure medically-fit patients are supported to return home as soon as possible following treatment . ''
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: thousands of pounds worth of meat stolen from butchers
text: almost £ 2,000 worth of meat has been stolen from an award-winning butchers .
thieves broke into archers butchers on plumstead road , norwich , in the early hours of this morning .
they stole burgers , bacon and ribs of beef , all of which was pre-packed .
owner jamie archer said : `` they were very determined .
they were well disguised , they were wearing balaclavas with baseball hats .
they were even wearing socks over their shoes .
`` they knew what they were doing .
they knew exactly where they were going and what they were helping themselves to . ''
norfolk police confirmed it was investigating the burglary .
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: police chief warns of online predators
text: parents in norfolk are being warned of the dangers their children may be facing online .
a conference is being held in norwich today to highlight the risks of internet grooming .

norfolk 's chief constable simon bailey , who heads a team that investigates online child abuse , said : `` whilst technology is overwhelming a force for good , there is no doubt that there is a very dark side to it .
`` there are paedophiles and sexual predators out there who are using technology to fulfill their own sexual desires , sexual fantasies .
`` unfortunately our children are the victims of that . ''
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

full details about how you can be there , get involved and watch it live can be found here .

documents.title: 'good ' red squirrels to help new reintroduction programme
text: red squirrels that have been raised at locations across norfolk are to help increase the native population as part of a new reintroduction programme in wales .
nearly 20 kittens have been reared by the east anglian red squirrel group this season at sites across the county including pensthorpe , kelling and weybourne .
chrissie kelley , head of species management at pensthorpe conservation trust , said : `` providing squirrels for the ogwen valley project is an extension of the work we 've done in anglesey .
`` they know we breed good squirrels and ours will be one of a number of breeding programmes contributing to the project as they need the widest genetic mix as possible . ''
once a common sight , red squirrels have declined rapidly since the 1950s .
they continue to be threatened by disease , the loss and fragmentation of woodland habitat and competition from the more robust grey squirrel , the wildlife trusts said .
red squirrel week runs until 2 october .

documents.title: coroner demanded full recordings or transcripts from crash
text: in january , an inquest into the deaths of four men in a helicopter crash in norfolk recorded verdicts of accidental death .
the crash , at gillingham , near the suffolk border , killed one of northern ireland 's richest men - lord ballyedmond , 70 (

pilots capt carl dickerson , of thornton , lancashire , and capt lee hoyle , 45 , of macclesfied , cheshire , were also killed , along with lord ballyedmond 's foreman declan small , 42 , of mayobridge , co down .
senior norfolk coroner jacqueline lake said the air accidents investigation branch ( aaib ) should provide recordings or at least a full transcript of what was said by those who were about to die .
but the aaib refused to comply and the coroner issued two £ 100 fines against the body 's chief inspector .

documents.title: helicopter crash recordings will remain confidential , court rules
text: voice and data recordings from a helicopter that crashed in norfolk , killing four people , will remain confidential , the high court has ruled .
the helicopter , carrying tory peer lord ballyedmond and three other men , crashed in thick fog in a field in gillingham , near beccles , in march 2014 .
during an inquest earlier this year , senior norfolk coroner jacqueline lake demanded disclosure of the helicopter 's cockpit voice and data recorder information .
but mr justice singh said there would be no `` public interest '' in disclosing the information .

documents.title: strictly come dancing : will balls flap over charleston ?
text: he 's bottom of the leader board after his waltz in week one of strictly come dancing failed to impress the judges , but this week norwich city chairman ed balls will be hoping to top up his score considerably with his second dance .

all the songs the 15 couples will be strutting their stuff to have now been revealed , and balls and his professional dance partner katya jones will be doing the charleston to alma cogan 's the banjo 's back in town .
i repeat , the former shadow chancellor of the exchequer will be dancing the charleston .
that is all .

documents.title: ambulance service bosses told to 'go back on the road '
text: the east of england ambulance service has said it is so short of staff that it 's told senior managers they have to go back on the road .
the bosses have been told they will have to do a minimum of two shifts a week responding to calls , because a number of a student paramedics have returned to university to complete their courses .
we 'll have more on this story during the day .

documents.title: mp says county council 's behaviour towards foster carers is 'shocking '
text: an mp says the behaviour of norfolk county council towards foster carers has been shocking .
three years ago , more than a dozen carers complained children had been taken away from them unfairly .
the council promised a review in may 2015 and the report is due to be released tomorrow , but several carers say they 've not been spoken to .

north norfolk mp norman lamb said : `` what i find extraordinary is this is a department that 's in special measures because the authorities have concluded that they 're not confident that they 're dealing with looked after children effectively enough , and yet they seem to be doing everything to undermine my faith in their ability to get their act together . ''
the council says it did contact the carers and some refused to take part .
author: Paul Moseley
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: red squirrels set for new home in welsh valley
text: red squirrels raised as part of a captive breeding programme in norfolk are to help establish a new colony in wales .

seven kittens from the east anglian red squirrel group are to be released in the ogwen valley , near bangor , following a successful project on anglesey which has seen grey squirrels eradicated from the island .

chrissie kelley , head of species management at pensthorpe conservation trust , and co-ordinator for the group , said : `` this is huge for us , it 's absolutely the best result for any captive breeding programme to get the squirrels back out into the wild . ''
numbers of red squirrels in the uk have fallen from about 3.5 million to an estimated population of around 120,000 , of which 75 % or more are in scotland , the wildlife trusts said .
there are only a handful of refuges left for red squirrels in the uk and the population in england is thought to be as low as 15,000 .

documents.title: rehabilitation unit set to close
text: a rehabilitation unit set up to stop bed-blocking at the norfolk and norwich hospital is to close .
the henderson unit at the julian hospital site , which opened at the start of last year , supports up to 24 people and helps patients who 've left hospital prepare for home .
sarah mason , whose 90-year-old aunt is being treated there , says closing it does n't make sense .
`` i think it 's absolutely crazy , '' she said .
`` i think it 's a really shortsighted decision , care agencies are struggling to put in extra support . ''
the norfolk and norwich hospital says the unit 's closing due to a lack of funding .
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rise in norfolk motorists caught using mobile phone behind the wheel
text: the number of drivers caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel is the highest in norfolk for five years , a bbc investigation has found .
officers from norfolk police stopped 2,287 drivers in 2015-16 compared to 836 in 2014-15 .
the figures were revealed after research suggested illegal mobile phone use by drivers was on the rise and ministers agreed to toughen penalties .
nationally , the number of motorists caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel has fallen by almost half in four years , it has been reported .
department for transport figures show that a driver impaired or distracted by their phone was a contributory factor in 492 crashes in britain in 2014 , including 21 that were fatal .

documents.title: jury sent home in gate-crush trial
text: the jury has been sent home today in the case of a man on trial for negligence and manslaughter , over the death of a grandmother crushed to death by an iron gate .
jill lunn , 56 had gone to close the remote control gate at her blofield heath home by hand .
norwich crown court has heard the gate fell as safety-stop devices had n't been installed .
robert churchyard , 51 , of turner road , norwich , denies gross negligence , manslaughter and breaching a general duty of care in his work .
the fitter worked for automated garage doors and gates on the sweet briar industrial estate , norwich .
the trial resumes on thursday .

documents.title: crackdown on illegal tobacco sales
text: this is yoyo with his handler stuart phillips .
the chocolate brown spaniel is one of a team of specialist dogs working in norfolk to search for illegal tobacco being sold in the county .
the dog team is taking a roadshow to five norfolk towns to make people more aware of tobacco and cigarettes being sold at pocket-money prices to tempt children into smoking .
scamp , a chocolate and brown spaniel , is seen here with his haul of illegal cigarettes that he sniffed out `` under counter '' at premises in king 's lynn today .
in the last two years , norfolk 's trading standards officers have seized hundreds of thousands of illegal cigarettes , with the perpetrators brought before the courts and convicted .

documents.title: body of fire victim has been recovered

documents.title: water restored to thousands of properties
text: water has been restored to about 2,000 homes and businesses in the king 's lynn area following a burst main this morning .
anglian water engineers are still dealing with the problem , but have re-routed supplies to the affected areas .
meanwhile , they 're dealing with a second water main that has burst on castle rising road at south wootton .
the company has apologised to those affected for any inconvenience .

documents.title: 'majority verdict ' will be accepted in gate-crush death case
text: the judge has told the jury he will accept a majority verdict in the case of a norfolk woman crushed to death by a gate .
jill lunn , of blofield heath , was pinned underneath an iron gate when the automatic mechanism failed .
the 56-year-old grandmother had gone to close the remote control gate by hand , leaving her granddaughter in her car nearby .
robert churchyard , 51 , of turner road , norwich , is on trial at norwich crown court .
the fitter , who worked for automated garage doors and gates on the sweet briar industrial estate , denies gross negligence , manslaughter and breaching a general duty of care in his work .

documents.title: 'leaving care system ' is daunting , says teenager
text: tom lee has been in care since he was five years old .
he 's now 17 and will leave the care system next year .
he says the prospect of living independently and budgeting is `` terrifying for young care leavers '' .
tom is one of the youngsters to be helped by the your own place project , which helps youngsters leaving care .
coming out of care will be a lot harder for him , he says , as he does n't have anything to fall back on .
the social enterprise project has leased a two-bedroom flat in norwich .
it has stickers in the rooms showing the cost of day-to-day living , from using the oven to taking a daily shower .

you have to budget , and you worry about bills , taxes and shopping it 's daunting for young people who 're moving into flats or renting privately it 's definitely terrifying for young care leavers . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: project aims to help care leavers live independently
text: a new project is starting in norwich to help young people who have been in care get a taste of independent life .
the social enterprise , called your own place , uses a real flat to help care leavers learn how to pay bills , budget and live independently .
a two-bedroom maisonette has been leased from norwich city council , and furnished with donations .
rebecca white from the project ( with tom lee , who 's to leave the care system next year ) says the flat will help prepare the youngsters for real life and allay their anxieties .

one hundred and fifty young people leave the care system in norfolk every year when they reach 18 they 're propelled into independence too early without the skills they need and they need support '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp 'has sore fist ' after reportedly hitting a wall
text: friends of norwich south mp clive lewis say he is in good spirits but nursing a sore fist after reportedly hitting a wall following his controversial conference speech yesterday .
it 's thought that mr lewis , who 's shadow defence secretary , was angry because his speech was changed at the last minute .
mr lewis had been expected to say that continued debate over trident was damaging the party 's re-election prospects and should be put on hold .
but many in the leadership disagree with him .
although embarrassing for mr lewis , he may have come out of this row quite well .
many delegates have told me they admire him for being pragmatic and trying to end in-fighting over such a controversial issue .

documents.title: water supplies returning to customers
text: water supplies are returning to king 's lynn and the surrounding villages after a burst water main cut them off earlier .
the main that burst is one of the major pipes supplying parts of king 's lynn and villages from west bilney to sutton bridge , and anglian water says about 2,000 properties have been affected .
engineers have now isolated the leak , and water is being routed from other parts of the system .
council officials checked food premises to make sure they could meet hygiene requirements this morning , but several had back-up tanks to ensure they could open .
a second water main burst complicated the this morning - on castle rising road at south wootton .
water engineers are now on the scene .

text: a man who died in a collision on the a1122 at fincham , near downham market , has been described as having a `` love of life . ''

documents.title: horses led to safety after fire breaks out
text: fourteen horses had to be led to safety from their stables after a fire at a livery yard at woodbastwick , near norwich , last night .
the fire broke out in a boat-building workshop which joins buildings at the ferry farm livery yard .
eight crews were called to the incident shortly before 22:30 , with most appliances leaving by 04:00 .
one remained on site until 10:30 to check the blaze did n't reignite .
violet hill , owner of the livery , where 36 horses were stabled , says there is structural damage to a building , and insurance assessors are due today .
in the meantime , she says it 's `` business as usual '' .

text: trains between norwich , ipswich , colchester and london are suffering serious disruption after a lorry hit a bridge at romford this morning .

passengers on the southend line are also affected .
`` we are sorry if your journey has been affected by this problem .
network rail engineers have worked as quickly as possible to resolve this problem and restore a normal train service , '' an abellio greater anglia spokesperson said .

documents.title: water supplies 'should return ' by 10:30
text: engineers from anglian water are working to restore supplies to thousands of properties in west norfolk that have been affected by a burst main .
the area affected extends from sutton bridge in the west to little massingham in the east , and southwards from dersingham down to west bilney .
anglian water says it expects customers to start receiving some water , at a lower pressure , by 10:00 , with full pressure to be restored by 10:30 .
water supplies may look a little cloudy or discoloured when they return , and customers are advised to run the tap for several minutes until the water runs clear .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich south mp 'a good friend ' of labour leader
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn is playing down reports of a row within the party , following a speech by shadow defence secretary and norwich south mp clive lewis .

in an interview with our political reporter , andrew sinclair , mr corbyn he 'd `` been in discussions '' with mr lewis , as his does with all colleagues before they make statements on behalf of the party , and .
they 'd had `` a nice chat and a cup of tea '' following the speech .
mr corbyn emphasised that discussions were held with all colleagues `` on the contributions they 're going to make this is how to try and bring people together '' .
asked whether he was happy with the norwich south mp 's role in the shadow cabinet , he replied : `` we 're getting on fine . ''
he invited me to norwich i 'll take up his invitation and i 'll be very happy to come to norwich with him - he 's a good friend , i 've known him for a long time . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: engineers working to restore water supplies
text: as we mentioned earlier , a burst water main has left thousands of properties in west norfolk without supplies , or with low pressure .
anglian water has just tweeted on the issue .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich mp plays down reports of row over speech
text: the norwich south mp and shadow defence secretary clive lewis is playing down reports of a row within the labour party following his speech over its nuclear weapons policy .
it 's alleged that jeremy corbyn 's office made some last-minute changes to mr lewis 's speech .
mr lewis was said to have been angry when he came off the stage at the party 's conference in liverpool , but he says there 's no row and he was `` really pleased with the speech '' .
we 've got policy and that was quite clearly and explicitly explained in the speech i think everyone 's happy and we 're all moving forward . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp 's 'anger ' over changes to defence speech
text: the norwich south mp clive lewis is at the centre of a row within the labour party , following his speech over nuclear weapons .
in a speech at the conference in liverpool yesterday , mr lewis , the shadow defence secretary , talked about labour 's policy on the trident nuclear weapons programme .
he told delegates he was sceptical about the need to renew trident but was `` clear '' that it was labour 's policy to do so .
it was later claimed that this was n't quite the speech the mp had wanted to give .

it 's alleged jeremy corbyn 's senior spin doctor seumas milne changed mr lewis 's speech moments before he was due to deliver it and afterwards mr lewis was seen punching a wall and throwing his phone in anger .
a senior labour source confirmed that mr lewis was upset at late changes to his speech on a number of defence issues .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

anglian water says a burst main is to blame .
the company has technicians working to shut off the leak , but it will take a while for pressure to return to normal .

text: hello and thanks for joining us for thursday 's norfolk live , where we 'll have the latest news , sport and travel updates for the county .

documents.title: some facts about tope sharks
text: a tope shark can grow up to 6ft ( 1.8m ) , and the one spotted in a tide pool at brancaster was estimated to be almost that size .

documents.title: watch : video of shark seen off norfolk coast
text: this is the shark that took visitors to the north norfolk coast by surprise yesterday .
believed to be a tope , the 5-6ft ( 1.5-1.8m ) fish had become trapped in a pool at brancaster when the tide was going out .
tope are not uncommon to the uk , but are usually found around the south east , southern and western coasts .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: top ukulele players come to uke east in norwich
text: the three-day uke east festival over the weekend attracted top acts from around the country to norwich and included a big busk for charity in the city centre ( below ) .
the event , in its third year , was headlined by the mother ukers from bournemouth and east anglian band the bijoux toots ( both .
at the norwich arts centre on the saturday night .
the festival also including performances by norwich ukulele soloist and singer/songwriter liam capper starr and suffolk band bex and freda ( both .
below ) .
the big busk in the centre of norwich on sunday ( the final day of the festival ) raised money for charity musical keys .

documents.title: arrest following drugs discovery in west norfolk
text: heroin has been seized , which norfolk police says has a street value of between £ 18,000 and £ 19,000
officers found the drugs when carrying out a routine search outside a property in mill street , swaffham , shortly after 14:30 on friday .
a 57-year-old man from the swaffham area was arrested on sus of possession with intent to supply a class a drug , and later released on bail pending further inquiries .

documents.title: mp 's comments on backing trident come under fire from anti-nuclear campaigners
text: anti-nuclear campaigners have attacked labour after their shadow defence secretary restated the party 's support for renewing the uk 's trident missiles , despite jeremy corbyn 's opposition .
clive lewis , the mp for norwich south , told the party conference that despite his scepticism about renewing trident , he was `` clear '' that it was the party 's policy to do so .

the campaign for nuclear disarmament , whose vice-president is labour leader jeremy corbyn ( seen here addressing protestors at a stop trident rally in february ) says mr lewis 's comments would cause `` huge disappointment '' and meant the party had `` abandoned '' its review of defence policy .

the norwich south mp warned the conference that the prime minister theresa may was using the issue of trident renewal as a `` political weapon aimed at her party 's opposition at home - us , so let 's not make ourselves an easy target '' .
the trident issue has caused a deep rift within the labour party when mps voted overwhelmingly in favour earlier this year to renew the uk 's nuclear deterrent system .
mr corbyn was condemned by some of his own mps for opposing trident .

documents.title: woman arrested on sus of taking drugs into prison
text: a woman has been arrested on sus of drug offences at wayland prison .
prison officers seized what 's believed to be a psycho-active substance during visiting time at the prison on friday , 23 september .
a 51-year-old woman was arrested on sus of conveying a prohibited article into a prison and possession with intent to supply a controlled substance .
she was taken to wymondham police headquarters for questioning , and later released on bail pending further inquiries until 24 november .

documents.title: ten involved in 'large scale disorder ' in the fens
text: four people have been arrested after police were called to a fight involving 10 people in leverington , near wisbech , yesterday evening .
cambridgeshire police said three men - one aged in his teens , one in his 30s and another in his 40s - along with a woman in her 40s , were arrested on sus of affray .
all four remain in custody in king 's lynn .
good job we have plenty of these , yesterday evening we dealt with a large scale disorder in # leverington needing @ twitterid help # 1134
what happened ?
i come from leverington and have n't heard of anything ?
no one else knows either !
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shark spotted off norfolk
text: visitors to the norfolk coast spotted this shark in a tide pool near brancaster .
david gregg says the shark was between 5-6ft ( 1.5-1.8m ) long , and was dipping in and out of the pool 's surface , near to the royal west norfolk golf course yesterday .
mr gregg says his wife had been letting their cocker spaniel dog go in and out of the water - but he was soon put on a lead .
the shark is believed to be a tope , or smooth-hound .

documents.title: two taken to hospital following house fires
text: two people were taken to hospital following two separate house fires in norfolk this morning .
paramedics from the east of england ambulance service attended an address in glebe way , horstead , shortly after 03:00 .
an elderly woman was treated for burns to her legs and taken to the norfolk & norwich university hospital ( nnuh ) .
in the second incident shortly before 04:15 , two ambulance crews were called to a house fire in field lane , hempnall where they treated a man for burns to his arms .
the patient , in his late teens , was also taken the nnuh .

documents.title: firefighters knew blaze victim personally
text: investigations into the cause of a fatal house fire in heacham could continue into tomorrow .
jonathan wilby , of norfolk fire and rescue service , says firefighters called to the blaze were confronted with a well-developed fire on the ground and first floor of the property .
he praised the work of fire crews in stopping the blaze from spreading into neighbouring properties .
parish councillor tracey swann died in the blaze .
she 'd fought a successful campaign to keep the village 's fire station open when it was threatened by cuts .
mr wilby says the heacham crew who attended the fire knew her personally and were `` very saddened '' by her death .
mr wilby says emergency services were alerted to the blaze by neighbours who heard and smelt the fire .
it was a severe fire with temperatures between 800c and 1000c .
we do n't know the origin , but we 're trying to establish the most likely cause it will take some time . ''

documents.title: 'a privilege to serve the party ' says euro mp
text: the east of england euro mp richard howitt was given a standing ovation as he gave his final speech to the labour party conference in liverpool .
after more than 22 years in the european parliament , he 's leaving politics for the world of business .
speaking to delegates , mr howitt said it had been `` an enormous privilege to serve the party '' .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: mp wants defence contracts to go to british companies
text: norwich south mp clive lewis has spoken to the labour conference for the first time as shadow defence secretary .
mr lewis told the conference in liverpool that , having served in afghanistan , he saw `` no conflict between my service and my socialism '' .

mr lewis skirted over the controversial issue of trident but said he was `` sceptical '' about its renewal , committed labour to supporting the 2 % gdp level of spending on defence and said he wanted all defence contracts to go to british companies .
he received a standing ovation from party members .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: mep hopes labour leader will help the party 's rift
text: a senior member of the labour party in the east of england says jeremy corbyn needs to take steps to restore relations within the party .
richard howitt , the party 's only euro mp representing the eastern region , joined colleagues in calling for party unity following the leadership election results .
but he says mr corbyn needs to play his part .

if he was , for example , to agree to the elected shadow cabinet to really heal the rift with the mps , then that would be a real sign that things will be changed in westminster let 's hope he does it . ''

documents.title: strictly 's ed : 'conservative and politically correct '
text: ed balls admits he `` messed up '' his debut dance on bbc one 's strictly come dancing , missing a few steps as he waltzed around the floor with partner katya jones .
but what did the judges think ?
craig revel horwood was first to give his verdict , interrupted by boos from the audience .
he thought it a `` little pedestrian you need to get some rise and fall in there better luck next time , darling '' .

darcey bussell saw a `` glimmer of a nice elegant gentleman '' , following up with some advice for the nerves - `` think of a narrative , a story to give you direction and i think you 'll be fine well done . ''

head judge les goodman was `` pleasantly surprised '' admitting to thinking `` he ai n't going to be much good but you 're what strictly is about you 're someone who does n't dance , you 've come out , you 've had a nice hold and i congratulate you . ''
the final words from flamboyant judge bruno tonioli : `` surprisingly conservative , very prim , very proper overall very politically correct '' .
and the scores ?
fives from craig , darcey and bruno , and a six from len .
the total of 21 puts the former shadow chancellor at the bottom of the leader board .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thirty labour members in east join lib dems after corbyn re-election
text: since saturday , 30 labour members have quit the party and joined the liberal democrats in the east of england , according to the lib dem 's regional chairman .
stephen robinson told me a number of people switched after jeremy corbyn was re-elected following his convincing win over rival owen smith .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: watch : ed balls on strictly
text: the class of 2016 took to the dance floor this weekend for the first time with their professional dancing partners when bbc one 's strictly come dancing returned to our tv screens .
one of those chasing this year 's glitterball trophy is norwich city chairman and former mp ed balls .

with katya jones , their waltzed around the floor to the elvis presley number are you lonesome tonight ? , but unfortunately the couple came bottom of the leader board despite getting a five from notoriously harsh judge craig revel horwood .
mr balls later admitted he was `` madly disappointed '' with his performance , and had been better in rehearsals , adding he felt like he 'd let katya down .
the competition gets underway properly next weekend , when viewers get to vote for their favourite dances for the first time , and then the first couple will leave the show .
good luck ed things can only get better !
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp to make first ever conference speech
text: it 's a big day for the norwich south mp , clive lewis .
the shadow defence secretary is giving his first ever conference speech at the labour party conference in liverpool .
defence is a controversial issue within the party , with many members divided over trident and syria .

mr lewis tells me he feels `` quite daunted '' by the prospect of addressing conference , adding `` i 've only been in the shadow cabinet for just over two month - it 's been a very steep learning curve . ''
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: tributes to victim of house fire
text: flowers have been left outside the caley street home of tracey swann - the victim of a house fire in heacham on saturday night .
local resident and family friend sam robinson has spoken of his shock at the death of the well-known parish councillor .
he says he can not believe that `` something like this could have happened to someone who 'd done so much for the village '' .

almost every single person down this street knows tracey and are all friends with her she does so much for the village - she set up the youth club , does so much for the parish council , helped with the carnival every year she 's done everything it 's very sad . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: separate roof voids helped stop fire spreading
text: members of norfolk 's urban search and rescue unit have been helping shore up a property in heacham to make it structurally sound for police and fire investigators to enter , following a blaze which claimed the life of a woman .
the victim , tracey swann , had campaigned successfully to keep the village 's retained fire station opened after it was earmarked for potential closure last year in a round of council cuts .
it was given a reprieve in february .
flowers have been laid outside the fire station in tribute to ms swann who was a parish councillor .
two dogs were rescued from the terraced house , which was badly damaged in the blaze which broke out on saturday night .

jonathan wilby , of norfolk fire and rescue service , says it was lucky the fire did n't spread , saying this was down to the work of the first crews to turn up and also that the property did n't have common roof voids with its neighbours .

we 'd just like to say how sorry we are at the loss of life here and we 'll do everything in our powers to make sure we establish the cause and origin and hopefully prevent a tragedy like this happening again . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich city youngster hits spectacular winner in scotland
text: norwich city midfielder james maddison is making his mark for scottish premiership side aberdeen where he is currently on loan .
the 19-year old scored a spectacular 90th minute free-kick to clinch a 2-1 win over rangers at pittodrie on sunday .
maddison has scored twice in his first four games for the dons .
his loan spell from norwich lasts until january .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: norwich city defender celebrates first ever 'pro ' goal
text: norwich city start the week at the top of the championship table after a 3-1 win over burton albion at carrow road .
defender ivo pinto wrapped up the win by scoring the third goal in the 89th minute and he revealed afterwards it was the first time he had ever scored in senior professional football .
the 26-year old who has previously played for clubs in portugal , romania and croatia told me `` i 'm very happy that has happened in front of this fantastic crowd and this goal is for them . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: community 'shell-shocked ' at death of parish councillor
text: st mary 's church in heacham was opened yesterday evening for villagers to pray and remember tracey swann , a parish councillor who died in a fire at her home on saturday night .
the reverend veronica wilson says the community is `` shell-shocked , numb and grieving '' .
candles were lit and paper was available for those who wished to write a tribute to go into a book of remembrance .
ms swann , who had set up a successful campaign against the closure of the village 's retained fire station , leaves a son , mother and brother .

the vicar says tracey did a lot for individuals `` just quietly and gently getting on with it she was on the parish council , involved in many committees , set up a youth club , and ran the carnival '' .
my of her is wearing a fluorescent jacket because she was infamous for directing traffic and organising cars we shall miss her . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire campaigner dies in house blaze
text: investigations are underway into the cause of a blaze in which a fire campaigner died .
parish councillor tracey swann was found dead at her fire-ravaged home in caley street , heacham , on saturday night .
she 'd helped to set up a successful campaign last year to fight the closure of the west norfolk village 's retained fire station .
a fire engine from heacham was one of the six to attend the scene .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
